comment.line: Controls (1=Yes,0=No) if Manufacturing Lot is used when generating Pick Order Lines.
Controls (1=Yes,0=No) if Storage Lot is used when generating Pick Order Lines.
If FIFOPLUS = 0 then picking occurs strictly according to FIFO.
If FIFOPLUS = 20 then FIFO can differ with 20 days from oldest day on Item Load.
If the Packing Material Types also can exist as a saleable product it has a Product Number as stocked product. Otherwise this is <null>.
Controls (1=Yes,0=No) if Manufacturing Lot has to be registered at Reception.
Controls (1=Yes,0=No) if Marketing Lot has to be registered at Reception.
Controls (1=Yes,0=No) if Storage Lot has to be registered at Reception.

If FIFOPLUS = 20 then FIFO can differ with 20 days from oldest day on Item Load.
If the Packing Material Types also can exist as a saleable product it has a Product Number as stocked product. Otherwise this is <null>.
Controls (1=Yes,0=No) if Manufacturing Lot has to be registered at Reception.
Controls (1=Yes,0=No) if Marketing Lot has to be registered at Reception.
Controls (1=Yes,0=No) if Storage Lot has to be registered at Reception.

column.caption: Interval between Audits for Item Load (days)

comment.line: Interval between Audits for Item Load (days)
The number of days that has to pass from a previous inventory audit before the system is allowed to generate an new inventory audit order for the product's Item Loads.
No mean that it is a transit goods.
The rate of turnover in the warehouse, controls where the Products will be stored.
There is an on going package change on Product- Lowest Unit of Measure.
Controls (1=Yes,0=No) if Storage Lot is used when generating Pick Order Lines.
Controls (1=Yes,0=No) if Manufacturing Lot has to be registered at Reception.
Controls (1=Yes,0=No) if Marketing Lot has to be registered at Reception.
Controls (1=Yes,0=No) if Storage Lot has to be registered at Reception.

column.caption: Interval between Audits for Item Load (days)

comment.line: Interval between Audits for Item Load (days)
The number of days that has to pass from a previous inventory audit before the system is allowed to generate an new inventory audit order for the product's Item Loads.
No mean that it is a transit goods.
The rate of turnover in the warehouse, controls where the Products will be stored.
There is an on going package change on Product- Lowest Unit of Measure.
Controls (1=Yes,0=No) if Storage Lot is used when generating Pick Order Lines.
Controls (1=Yes,0=No) if Manufacturing Lot has to be registered at Reception.
Controls (1=Yes,0=No) if Marketing Lot has to be registered at Reception.
Controls (1=Yes,0=No) if Storage Lot has to be registered at Reception.
Number of Lowest Unit of Measurement
Packing Material Type that is always connected to the Product Package when receiving. Can be <null>.
Packing Material Type that is always connected to the Product Package when picking/shipping. Can be <null>.
If the Package is a layer package in a pallet (1=Yes,0=No). Used for calculating the number of and height of Item Load, e.g. when receiving goods.
The fill factor for case pick load carrier, default <null> has the same effect as 100%.

For example balls will take up more volume in the pick load carrier (Case Pick Volume % is greater than 100) while flower pots that can be piled one onto the other take up less volume (Case Pick Volume % is less than 100).
Bar Code used in outgoing ASN.
Number of Lowest Unit of Measurement
Packing Material Type that is always connected to the Product Package when receiving. Can be <null>.

The fill factor for case pick load carrier, default <null> has the same effect as 100%.

For example balls will take up more volume in the pick load carrier (Case Pick Volume % is greater than 100) while flower pots that can be piled one onto the other take up less volume (Case Pick Volume % is less than 100).
Bar Code used in outgoing ASN.

Other values = Just information in the Warehouse system.

Is received from the host system and might be a specification of the Ship-to Address for the shipping of the Customer Order Line, like Floor 3 or Gate 7.
Controls which goods may be picked for the Pick Order Line:
1 = Any Lot (must belong to a Lot)
2 = Only one Lot (must belong to the same Lot)
3 = Specified Lot (must belong to the Lot stated in the PRODLOT field)
The Number of Lowest UMs that the ordered Quantity in a Pick Order Line can differ by upwards, so that this package/unit may still be picked.
The Number of Lowest UMs that the ordered Quantity in a Pick Order Line can differ by downwards, so that this package/unit may still be picked.
The Quantity of the Component Product that is needed for each copy of the Kit Product.
The financial conditions for the Customer Order Line, which VAT applies.
Controls (true/false) if the goods shall be measured when picking (Quantity check). Only valid for Case Pick Order Lines!
Sequence Number of the Purchase Order that the receipt is connected to.
Position Number on the Purchase Order Line.
Sub Line Number on the Purchase Order Line. Together with the Purchase Order Line it makes the Purchase Order Line unique.
The final recipients Purchase Order Number. Used for transit goods.

A flag indicating if the Load should be connected to a departure or not.
A code indicating how the date/time fields should be evaluated.
S = Ship - FPSHIPDTM and LPSHIPDTM are valid
D = Delivery - FPDELDTM and LPDELDTM are valid
This is the first possible delivery date/time at Customer site. Valid if Date Selection Type = Deliver
This is the last possible delivery date/time at Customer site. Valid if Date Selection Type = Deliver
This is the first possible shipping date/time from the Warehouse. Valid if Date Selection Type = Ship
This is the last possible shipping date/time from the Warehouse. Valid if Date Selection Type = Ship

This is only used if you want to include information about a Packing Material connected to the product. Then this field shows the identity of the Stocked Product for the saleable form of the Packing Material. This way the system can identify the Lowest Unit of Measure for the received product.
